title: Croze 2013 Cabernet Sauvignon (Oakville)
description: This largely tannic wine clearly needs time to open in the glass or on the table. It initially shows herbal elements around a core of clove and black cherry. Well-made, it's structured and a good match for meals.

title: Undurraga 2013 T.H. Terroir Hunter Alto Maipo Cabernet Sauvignon (Pirque)
description: Composed, lightly woody aromas of berry fruits, spice and herbs are harmonious and earthy. This spunky Cabernet reflects a cool vintage via pepper, tomato, herb and berry flavors. A layered yet snappy finish shows good length and complexity.

title: Voliero 2011  Brunello di Montalcino
description: Leather, truffle, baked plum and a whiff of cake spice lead the nose on this robust, accessible wine. The meaty, monolithic palate also has rustic charm and juicy appeal, offering fleshy wild cherry, raspberry confiture, anise and chopped herb alongside chewy tannins. Drink sooner rather than later.

title: Tenuta Friggiali 2011  Brunello di Montalcino
description: This opens with aromas that recall scorched earth, forest floor, black-skinned berry and a whiff of dark cooking spice while the ripe, juicy palate doles out wild cherry, raspberry, cinnamon and a licorice note. Firm, mature tannins provide the framework. Drink 2017–2022.

title: Wittmann 2014 100 Hills Dry Pinot Blanc (Rheinhessen)
description: Forward but fresh, this elegant Pinot Blanc juxtaposes rich peach and mango flavors with a zesty acidic spine. The finish is sleek and a bit steely. Ready now but should drink well through 2020.

title: Wittmann 2014 Trocken Rosé (Rheinhessen)
description: Cool tones of slate and stone accent delicate sour cherry and raspberry flavors in this sprightly dry rosé. Zippy and thirst quenching, yet firmly anchored in minerality, it's an elegant rosé for year-round enjoyment. Drink now.

title: World's End 2014 Rebel Rebel Reserve Chardonnay (Napa Valley)
description: Named for a great David Bowie song, this wine would appeal to Ziggy Stardust himself with its chameleon-like ability to swing between steely and sultry, almost sweet, diving into decadence with ease. Lemon peel and grilled pineapple marry well with generous yet managed oak, finishing creamy and quick.

title: Château Flotis 2011 Si Noire Negrette (Fronton)
description: Spice and red pepper flavors combine with juicy red fruits in this wine. It comes from selected parcels of Négrette on the slopes of Fronton. The wood aging has smoothed out the tannins although they still need more time to fully round out. Drink from 2019.

title: W.H. Smith 2012 Solo Estate Red (Howell Mountain)
description: Consisting of both Merlot and Cabernet Franc, this homegrown effort begins with a suggestion of deli meat and campfire, evocative aromas that persist through on the palate. Toasted oak and a touch of heat follow, buoyed by sizable fists of cinnamon and cherry, finishing in dried herb.

title: Schramsberg 2012 Blanc de Blancs Sparkling (North Coast)
description: One of Schramsberg's younger releases, and made from all white grapes, this wine has tantalizing aromas of vanilla, apple and light toast that lead to layered and creamy flavors. A nice brisk balance with good acidity underlies the spice and fruit.

title: La Rioja Alta 2007 Viña Ardanza Reserva  (Rioja)
description: Dry, leathery, slightly nutty aromas are more earthy than fruity. This mature Rioja is fresh and light on the palate, with leafy, spicy flavors of plum, tobacco and wood grain. Spicy berry and cocoa flavors grace a fading finish. Drink now.

title: Prager 2010 Petite Sirah (Napa Valley)
description: This 100% varietal wine was given two-and-a-half years in barrel, the majority of it new American oak. Smoky in character, it has a compressed and extracted feel, built around sizable punches of black plum, cedar, earth and coffee. It's big, but good.

title: Presqu'ile 2013 Chardonnay (Santa Maria Valley)
description: Sea salt, lemon, lime, grapefruit blossoms and a touch of ripe nectarine give complex depth to the nose of this high-end winery's larger-production white. The palate offers similar flavors, from brisk lime juice and sliced apples to warmer touches of sea-salt caramel.

title: Producteurs Plaimont 2012 Beret Noir  (Saint-Mont)
description: Celebrating both the wide beret worn by Gascon men and the local Tannat grape, this firm wine is rich and concentrated. It has dusty tannins that support the dark berry fruits and balancing acidity. The bright, fruity character suggests it will keep until 2018.

title: Puntí Ferrer 2012 Conforme Cabernet Sauvignon (Curicó Valley)
description: This extracted, dark-colored Cabernet Sauvignon opens with olive, herb and blackberry aromas. In the mouth, it's round as a ball but not overly dense or tannic. Burnt, charred flavors of plum and berry come with a saucy, savory accent, while this finishes with herbal notes and unresolved tannins. Drink through 2020.

title: Quinta da Lagoalva de Cima 2014 Reserva Red (Tejo)
description: A bold, ripe wine that is rich and ready to drink. The tannins, the dry core that just supports the black fruits and the attractive acidity are all balanced. This is an immediately attractive, rounded wine. Drink now.

title: Quinta da Lixa 2015 Pouco Comum Alvarinho (Minho)
description: An Alvarinho that comes from the southern Minho, close to the Douro River, this is a perfumed, ripe and richly textured wine. Pear and green plum fruits are combined with fine acidity and tangy lemon zest minerality to create a fresh while rich wine. Drink from late 2016.

title: Quinta do Crasto 2014 Superior Branco White (Douro)
description: This is a beautifully perfumed, lightly wood-aged wine. With grapes from the Douro Superior, it is rich while remaining impressively fresh. There are apricot and ripe pear flavors that are given a smoky, toasty edge by the wood aging. It is ready to drink.

title: Pelvillain Frères 2014 Inspiration 7.5.3 Malbec (Cahors)
description: As part of a range of wines that uses the figure seven because of its mystic qualities, grower Didier Pelvillain has produced a wine that is dark, smooth and ripe. It has fine berry fruits and dusty tannins that are still lifted by the youthful acidity. Give it until 2019 to fully develop.

title: Peterson 2012 Bradford Mountain Estate Vineyard Petit Verdot (Dry Creek Valley)
description: Dusty violets rise on the nose of this wine, from an estate planting and blended with 13% Cabernet Franc, 6% Merlot and 6% Malbec. Restrained tannins provide a shy backbone, seasoned in cedar and tar, making for an ultimately quaffable experience.

title: Pflüger 2014 Ungsteiner Herrenberg Trocken Riesling (Pfalz)
description: Stacked layers of crystalline minerality add lift to this luscious, ripe Riesling. It's dry in style with restrained apple and pear flavors, but the texture is clingy and dense. Chalk and saline notes reverberate on the finish.

title: Together 2013 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Smoky in toasted oak, this textured, layered wine has a full body and considerable length, highlighted by chocolate mocha and black cherry.

title: Willful 2013 Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)
description: The gentle touch of the winemaker is clearly visible in this soft but substantial effort. Light cherry fruit, a streak of mocha and a hint of hazelnut combine gracefully. The tannins have a pleasant chalkiness. Native yeasts were employed, giving an extra dash of depth and complexity.

title: Bacigalupi 2014 Estate Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
description: This is a generous white from the famous vineyard site, robust in toasted oak and big flavors of butterscotch and vanilla. Youthful, it opens in the glass to find more of its ripe fruit, from Gravenstein apple to baked pear.

title: Domaine Costa Lazaridi 2014 Château Julia Assyrtico (Drama)
description: Brisk and bright aromas of grapefruit and lemon start this assertive and distinctive Assyrtiko. On the palate, mineral and crisp flavors are balanced by a savory spin on the backpalate. Balanced and multilayered, the wine will pair with spicy and delicate foods alike.

title: Cave du Marmandais 2014 Château la Vieille Eglise Red (Côtes du Marmandais)
description: The vineyards of Marmande are on the north bank of the Garonne River, east of Bordeaux. This wine, produced by the cooperative from a single vineyard, is dense, concentrated and full of both fine fruit and tannins. It has juicy black fruits that are sustained by the dusty texture. The aftertaste with its acidity is fresh and fruity. Drink from 2018.

title: Chassenay d'Arce 2006 Blanc de Blanc Millesimé Brut Chardonnay (Champagne)
description: With its creamy texture and ripe apple fruits, this is a rich, rounded style. It is certainly fresh while also having yellow and white stone fruit flavors cut by acidity and citrus. Coming from the southern Côte de Bar, this is an open fruity Champagne that still has plenty of the proper steely aftertaste. At nine years, the wine is ready to drink.

title: Château du Cèdre 2014 Cèdre Heritage Malbec (Cahors)
description: This is a big-hearted, ripe wine from the Verhaeghe family, one of the top producers in Cahors. It is packed with black fruits and firm tannins. They promise richness to come with structure, wood aging flavors and density. It's a wine that is just starting out, still boasting its youthful fruit. Give it until 2020 before drinking.

title: Bennett Lane 2013 Sangiacomo Vineyard Reserve Chardonnay (Los Carneros)
description: This is a nicely sour, flinty and balanced full-bodied wine from a cool-climate site. Despite its roundness and warmth, this finds a way to be light and lean in between the luxuriousness and generous nature of the vintage and style.

title: Bennett Lane 2014 Maximus White Feasting Wine White (Napa Valley)
description: The producer's proprietary blend of 89% Sauvignon Blanc, 10% Chardonnay and 1% Muscat, this wine is fresh and fiery, bright on the palate in apple, Asian pear and jicama, with a dusting of dried herb and ginger as it goes down.
